main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Cleveland, Ohio in 1956, involving one round object traveling at a speed of 40-50 knots and a glowing light moving in an erratic, zigzag manner at a great speed.
interesting points: The first sighting described a round object the size of a pinhead traveling for 15 minutes at a speed of 40-50 knots, with no known direction.
The second report detailed a glowing light in the sky moving from the NNW to SE at great speed, disappearing into the distance.
The third report mentioned an erratic, zigzag movement of a bright light in the sky, which disappeared and reappeared at a different location.
The writer of the third report was unable to conduct a field investigation or obtain photographic evidence of the object.
The UFO was not tracked on radar at any time, adding to the mystery of the sightings.
sighted object: round object and glowing light in the sky
witnesses: civilian, AF (GOC), James Kihling, control tower operator, several persons on the ground
